title: February Practice News Day as it happened - BBC News
summary: school reporters around the uk are having their final practice ahead of news day .
school report 's 10th news day takes place on thursday 10 march .
there are plenty of resources available to help you and your students -

documents.title: practice news day live officially over !
text: well , that 's it for our fourth and final practice news day of 2015/16 .
thank you for all your hard work and for telling us about what you 've been up to .
we hope you 've enjoyed the day !
so now we 're counting down to the big day itself - news day on thursday 10 march .
until then , keep your ideas coming and keep across our student reports index to see what other schools have been up to .
please send us the url of your school report webpage so we can turn you green on our map and people can click through to your work directly from the bbc website .
remember our teachers resources index for loads of tips and advice on how to make this 10th anniversary of school report the best year ever !

documents.title: good luck first timers !
text: a big shout out to the the westminster school in rowley regis in the west midlands who are taking part in school report for the first time this year .
the team are planning to report on some exciting school trips and are keeping their audience updated with the latest chart news .

documents.title: serious brainstorming !
text: shs media studies
shsmediastudies

text: all saints ' english
allsaints eng

some fantastic articles and reporting .

documents.title: call for teachers to explain online bullying dangers
text: back to the elizabeth garrett anderson team and amrita told the forum that in schools , teachers do n't teach enough about dangers of bullying online and should start talking about it in primary schools as well .
she added that people that should be positive and see things from another perspective as well as their own .

documents.title: beacon of light
text: a big shout-out to the beacon school in buckinghamshire , who had their first school report get-together of the year this week .

documents.title: revision - is it necessary ?
text: a quick mention for the wren academy in finchley who are reporting on some of the teaching methods in their school , including vertical tutoring and single sex teaching for some subjects , as well as the eu referendum and revision - is it necessary ?

documents.title: school secrets of 1916 easter rising
text: school reporters from st malachy 's college in belfast explored their school archive to uncover the secrets of past pupils who fought in the 1916 easter rising in dublin .

documents.title: practice news day in an hour !
text: well done to school reporters at longcroft school in humberside who did their practice news day in an hour !

they 've been working on some `` in-school '' reports such as the latest results of their school hockey team and have also conducted an interview with one of the school 's year 11 students , who is a national judo champion .

documents.title: extra-time !
text: we have had so many updates that we are keeping the page going for a few minutes longer so we can feature as many of you as possible !

documents.title: day not over for ega students
text: this live page is drawing to a close soon - but the day is far from over for our gallant band from elizabeth garrett anderson school who are at safer internet day workshops and presentations in london as you can see from these photographs .

documents.title: practice news day proves to be a good learning curve
text: year 7 and 8 school reporters at all saints ' catholic academy in mansfield learnt a lot by taking part in practice news day .
wiktoria said she `` learnt how to edit audio clips '' .
dawid said he `` learnt how to edit videos '' .
amy `` enjoyed editing videos and watching how it is all done '' .
harriet .
said : `` i enjoyed writing an article . ''
ben added : `` i enjoyed saying jamie vardy 's having a party ! ''
well done to all at all saints !

documents.title: happy chinese new year in kent !
text: school reporters at bradfields academy in kent have been reporting on the chinese new year and internet safety .
they also had a visit from two members of the school report team !

documents.title: using youtube
text: many news organisations now use youtube to reach an even wider audience .
visit this page for help and to hear bbc youtube editor marko zoric explain how the corporation uses the video-sharing website .

documents.title: school reporters impress their teacher
text: school reporters from highcrest academy in high wycombe have impressed their teacher with their ideas !
miss meakes said : we have had some fab entries from our year 7 students on littering , national breakfast week and school football results .
it is really encouraging to see them engaging so well ! ''
keep up the great work team highcrest !

documents.title: calling all former school reporters - we need your help !
text: school report is celebrating its ' 10th birthday this year !
thousands of secondary school children from around the uk have taken part in the project since it started in 2007 - and we want to hear from them .

if you are a former school reporter , or know someone who took part in the project one year , please could you fill in our alumni survey , or pass it on , to help our continual improvement of the project for the future ?
do you remember how we looked back in 2007 ?
this shot of our first-ever homepage may remind you !

documents.title: school report treads the boards
text: pupils at the glyn school in ewell had a taste of the showbiz lifestyle recently with their very own red-carpet premiere of the latest school production - charlie and the chocolate factory .
the school 's school report team decided to host the preview to give students the opportunity to hone their broadcasting and interviewing skills .

`` the school production is always a big event and a major fixture on the calendar , and the fact that this year it comes close to school report day meant that it was a great opportunity to get twice as much activity and involvement from it , '' said english teacher , marise jeyarajah , who is helping run school report .

documents.title: it 's a dog 's life !
text: school reporters at cirencester deer park school are working hard on their stories , including a story about their school dog .
stay tuned to school report for more on their pet.and

documents.title: reporting from the bett show
text: school reporters from eastlea community school in canning town , east london , have been practising their journalistic skills at the bett technology show !
eastlea comm .
school
eastlea school
eastlea 's talented @ twitterid students reported from # bett2016 in preparation for # newsday
eastlea 's talented @ twitterid students reported from # bett2016 in preparation for # newsday

documents.title: five hours down , one to go !
text: five hours into practice news day live and students across the uk have been busy making the news .
these school reporters from elizabeth garrett anderson school in islington ( left to right : salina , lashay and ndey ) have been working at a special safer internet day event .
they were encouraged to fill in a heart with a message about staying safe online - # shareaheart .
with one hour to go , there 's just enough time to tell us what you 've been up to !
email us at schoolreport @ bbc.co.uk with your stories .

documents.title: take the school report video listicle challenge !
text: to mark bbc school report 's 10th anniversary , we 've come up with a listicle challenge !
a listicle is a numbered or bullet-point list which is published online , often as a text article .
but we 're challenging school reporters to come up with a short video in the form of a 10-item listicle .
choose your topic - it could be anything from 10 reasons why people should visit our town to 10 reasons why we love school report .
read more about the challenge here and watch our own listicle effort !

documents.title: learning tricks of the trade from a bbc expert
text: one of our bbc mentors richard murrell visited ormiston rivers academy in essex and worked with the school reporters on cutting and editing their audio reports .
eden and robyn in year 8 have produced a report on the problems with overcrowding outside the canteen at lunchtime .
marissa and isabel have produced a report on the issue of disruptive students in lessons .
they have had a fantastic day so far and have learnt lots about audio editing software and creating a seamless report .
this afternoon they will be perfecting their reports so they are seamless and ready to go !

documents.title: staying safe online
text: birkam and bianca , both 12 , from st mark 's church of england academy have been working on school report for three weeks and it 's finally time to put their hard work into practice .
they 're looking at safer internet day today and the dangers of the internet and how to stay safe by using the smart method .

documents.title: get your school green on the map !
text: is your school green on the school report map ?
schools are made red when they have registered , yellow when they have returned the consent forms and green when they have returned all forms and have also created a school report url webpage .
to check your status , click here .
remember the url of your dedicated school report web page means we can link to all the wonderful stories you 've been telling .
- and will be telling !

documents.title: unique reporting formats sought
text: walworth academy school reporters in southwark are pondering on how they can produce reports in unique formats , like illustration .
watch this space on 10 march to see what creative story-telling techniques they put into practice !

documents.title: reporters tackle tough to
text: the team at wildern school in hampshire is busy making three videos .
the subjects are :
- do kids feel safe in an age of terrorism ?
- can music save kids form getting depressed ?
- technology review piece on 9d television .
there are 18 school reporters working today , but a massive 380 taking part on news day !

documents.title: preparing for pop-up radio show
text: a warm welcome to pedmore technology college and community school in dudley who are taking part in practice news day at the last minute !

they have 21 school reporters involved today , with six of them recording a package for the pop-up radio show , being broadcast from birmingham on news day on 10 march , looking into conceptions around stereotypes .
the rest are currently investigating :
- are video games having a negative impact on pupils ' school grades ?
- looking into a planet beyond pluto
- do cadbury 's encourage young people to consume too much sugar ?
( will be researching more on a school trip to cadbury world )
- fizzy drinks vs water : a look inside the school canteen and pupils ' consumption of fizzy drinks during school hours .
we look forward to seeing the finished reports !

documents.title: europe : in or out ?
text: greenacre school in surrey have had a busy practice news day .
olivia and georgia have been reporting on the eu referendum and you can watch their video report at the bottom of their school report webpage .

documents.title: basketball proves popular in north london
text: students from quintin kynaston academy in north london are working on a range of story ideas ahead of news day .
they are reporting on their part in the model un project , their school council and why basketball is such a popular sport at their school - particularly among girls .

documents.title: tweet tweet !
text: twitter is a wonderful tool for promoting your stories .
but it 's not without its pitfalls .
read our school report guide to using twitter and tweeting safely , although remember you have to be aged 13 or over to have an account .

documents.title: immigration crisis in focus
text: students from haydon school in hillingdon are excited about being involved in the project and are currently carrying out research on issues such as the immigration crisis ( with a focus on how it is affecting the lives of children ) and global warming .

documents.title: how long could you go without sugar ?
text: school reporters at st mary 's catholic high school in croydon have been busy working on a story about sugar , their teacher miss spillane told school report hq this afternoon .
we 've brainstormed so many ideas but wanted one that affects all teenagers - so decided to investigate all aspects of sugar and sugar addiction .
`` the school reporters have been keeping video diaries as they try to go without sugar and have looked at the impact on their health in science . ''
school reporters at the mountbatten school in romsey are finishing off their reports on storm imogen , advances in spinal surgery and students ' sugar addictions !

documents.title: storm imogen
text: storm imogen caused quite a stir on monday .
when does the weather become news ?
find out more about when the weather can be a story for you .

documents.title: may the force be with you !
text: school reporters from archbishop tenison 's cofe high school in croydon have been visiting the nearby valence school and are reporting on technology to support students with sen .
abt news
abtnewscrew
we love this r2d2 remote control ! !
@ twitterid
we love this r2d2 remote control ! !
@ twitterid

documents.title: four hours down , two to go !
text: four hours into practice news day live and students across the uk , including school reporters from alperton community school in london , are busy making the news .
with two hours still to go , there 's plenty of time to tell us what you 're up to !
email us at schoolreport @ bbc.co.uk with your stories .

documents.title: celebrities interviewed
text: the school report team from elizabeth garrett anderson school in islington are now on to interviewing celebrities at their safer internet day event .
sarya and maibritt met r & b singers harvey cantwell and tallia storm .
harvey told them he wants to make young people more aware of staying safe online , while tallia is involved in anti-bullying campaigning
meanwhile amrita ( left middle ) and nadirah met youtube presenters sammy ( left ) and niki albon .
the 23-year-old twins present a twice-weekly video based on their observations of life around them , containing a bit of comedy and general entertainment .

documents.title: are term-time holiday fines fair ?
text: thanks to longsands academy in st. neots , cambridgeshire , for sending us a list of the stories they are working on for practice news day !
the stories they are looking into include term-time holidays - is it fair for parents to be punished for cheaper holidays ?
school reporters are also looking at the highs and lows of the academy 's sporting achievements , as well as women in sport and whether gender equality really exists .
they are also exploring whether the concept of `` bringing your own device '' can help - or hinder !
school resources .

documents.title: # shareaheart
text: charltonparkacademy
charltonsch
our student journalists are using # saferinternetday to practice for @ twitterid # shareaheart
our student journalists are using # saferinternetday to practice for @ twitterid # shareaheart
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid great photos - good to see you are enjoying pratcice news day !
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid thank you - lots happening today at our school .

documents.title: from dogs to airports !
text: the reporting team at charles darwin school are gearing up for their practice day on thursday .
on their agenda is a report about biggin hill airport and their families ' involvement in world war two and the issue of dogs and stereotypes .
happy reporting !

documents.title: is the fourth industrial revolution coming ?
text: a big shout-out to cheam high school in sutton , who are working on four video and text stories .
their subjects are :
- the zika virus
- the rise of artificial intelligence ( the fourth industrial revolution )
- the opening of a new free school in the area
- the recent advances in human genetic engineering .
yet another fascinating selection of to from bbc school reporters !

documents.title: questions , questions , questions - brian cox 's top tip
text: school reporters from pimlico academy in london had the chance to interview scientist brian cox at their former primary school churchill gardens primary academy .
`` what are your tips to secondary school students who want to become scientists ? ''
asked one student .
professor cox answered : `` continue to be interested , continue to ask questions and allow your imaginations to be captured by these things whatever they are .
`` even if it 's a blade of grass , say 'why is it green ?
what is it doing ?
how did it get there ?
how did such a complex thing that can take energy from the sun , take water and split the water up , and release oxygen and build sugars out of the energy from the sun and carbon dioxide .
how does it do that ? '
`` that 's the way to be a scientist .
just keep going and ask questions . ''

documents.title: pressure can be fun !
text: thirty s1 school reporters , aged 11 to 12 , at inveralmond community high school in west lothian have been reporting on a wide variety of to
these range from the devastating effect of earthquakes to asking how much would you pay for a bit of a celebrity , after a lock of john lennon 's hair went up for auction .
teacher mrs hansom said the students had enjoyed recording their pieces and were excited about getting out into the school community to get some opinions .
she added that the students had learned the importance of keeping to a deadline , with one school reporter saying : `` who knew pressure would be so much fun ? ''

documents.title: investigating celebrities ' use of social media
text: a group of year 9s are taking part in today 's practice news day at guildford county school in surrey .
they 're looking at :
- tips for staying online as part of safer internet day
- how celebrities use social media like twitter : for example , kanye west is asking followers to work out what his new album title stands for
the media 's impact on body image , after the new barbies of all body shapes were unveiled .
they have also interviewed two students who have english as an additional language ( eal ) - one from brazil and another from poland .

documents.title: staying on the right side of the law
text: every journalist must always be very careful not to break the law when producing stories and school reporters are no different .
this guide outlines the issues which teachers taking part in bbc news school report must consider before putting students ' work on a website .

documents.title: mp gets a grilling !
text: mp ben bradshaw was quizzed on a range of issues by school reporters at st james .
secondary school in exeter .
watch out john humphrys and well done st james !
ben bradshaw
benpbradshaw
excellent grilling from @ twitterid students for bbc school report on range of local , national & global issues .
excellent grilling from @ twitterid students for bbc school report on range of local , national & global issues .
glad you had an inspiring & challenging time @ twitterid would expect nothing less from @ twitterid students

documents.title: whitley reporters being inspected !
text: the whitley academy school reporters in coventry are in the middle of an inspection and are going to be asked some questions about what they are doing .
year 7 reporter duncan says : `` we shall most likely be asked about our experience as part of the student reporters and what we have learnt from it .
we will be answering the questions with confidence and show skills that we have learnt during the conference . ''

documents.title: school report team on school 's radar !
text: st edmund arrowsmith catholic high in wigan shared some exciting ideas .
one of the ideas they are most excited about is their year 8 group 's plan to cover internet safety and teens on social media .
as today is safer internet day , they want to make sure that all their peers and students attending school feel safe online .
they are interviewing a range of teachers and pupils .
another group of girls has planned to speak to one of the bbc school report team about our jobs , as several members of the team want to be journalists themselves !
another topic of interest is 'living like an olympian ' , which is being directed by six students who have a shared love of anything including sport and well-being .
they are currently emailing some of their favourite athletes .

documents.title: halfway there !
text: three hours into practice news day live and students across the uk , including these ones from waldegrave girls school in twickenham , are busy making the news .
with three hours still to go there 's plenty of time to tell us what you 're up to !
email us at schoolreport @ bbc.co.uk with your stories .

documents.title: calling former school reporters
text: are you a former school reporter ?
if so then we need your help .

as we celebrate our 10th anniversary , we are looking for anyone who has taken part in the project in the past nine years to fill out our short alumni survey and help us make the project even more successful .
thank you !

documents.title: from minecraft to eastenders
text: school reporters zak , taylor , aaron and kamil at charlton park academy in london had a great session coming up with ideas for news day , with potential story ideas from minecraft to eastenders .
aaron and taylor had a go practising their interview skills using a flash mic and asking each other about their favourite games , sports and tv shows .
they were also joined by former school reporters matt and derren who discussed the lack of signing on tv and how people with disabilities are portrayed on tv .

documents.title: come dine with us !
text: the icknield high school reporting team in luton are well under way with their reporting ideas and are hoping to start production later this week , before doing a full practice news day of their own after half-term .
they 're currently working on a report about why they love luton and a series relating to healthy eating including their own version of `` come dine with us '' - what will be on the menu we wonder ?

documents.title: report online concerns to parents or teachers
text: more from our school reporters from elizabeth garrett anderson school , who are involved in a childnet event for safer internet day .

they have been learning more about online safety and year 7 school reporter amrita , on the right of this photo with schoolmate nadirah , told us : `` it 's important to report anything bad you see online to parents or teachers . ''

documents.title: farringdon teaching internet safety all year round
text: farringdon community academy in sunderland have been taking part in practice news day .

some of their students were featured on bbc breakfast this morning talking about the bbc newsround survey which revealed that one in five 10-12 year olds with a social media account has been bullied online .
the school tell us that they keep the pupils constantly informed about online safety , rather than focusing on one safer internet day ,
in year 7 , students follow a scheme of work in ict which teaches them about protecting themselves online , including the dangers of things such as trolling and cyber-bullying .
they create posters and presentations detailing the dangers .
there is also a poster displayed at the school , which encourages students to think before posting `` if you would n't show your grandma - do n't post it ! ''

documents.title: girls with goals !
text: the reporting team at bishop challoner catholic collegiate girls school in east london are wearing their school report press passes with pride !
they are working on stories reflecting their school 's # girlswithgoals initiative , which aims to inspire girls to have ambitions and break away from any restrictions holding them back .
remember to fill in and return your forms to get your own school report press passes !

documents.title: no camera ? do n't worry , film on a smartphone !
text: if your school does n't have much high-tech equipment , do n't panic or feel you have to buy in lots of kit .
it 's not essential to have the latest gear to make good quality films - your students can record and edit their reports on a smartphone .
check out our top tips for filming with a smartphone .

text: hertswood academy
hertswooduk

documents.title: two hours down , four to go !
text: two hours into practice news day live and students across the uk , including these school reporters from longcroft school in yorkshire , are busy making the news .
with four hours still to go , there 's plenty of time to tell us what you 're up to !
email us at schoolreport @ bbc.co.uk with your stories .

documents.title: school reporters in downing street !
text: school reporters from elizabeth garrett anderson school in islington are taking part in an event for safer internet day .
they have already been involved in some workshops about how to make the internet a kinder place .
teacher nicole and school reporters salina , lashay , clara and ndey have just visited downing street as you can see from this photo !
they have more events to follow this afternoon so stay tuned for further updates !

documents.title: delhi pollution problems investigated
text: the school reporters at gandhi memorial public school in delhi are preparing to do interviews soon for their piece about pollution in the city .
they want to hear from a doctor on the effects that the pollution is having on children .
they also plan to track down a truck driver to find out what he does to maintain his truck to minimise pollution .
they aim to start recording soon !
marie lindsay
mariemccolgan
super skills from budding reporters interviewing me @ twitterid well done erika , aoife , holly & chloe
super skills from budding reporters interviewing me @ twitterid well done erika , aoife , holly & chloe
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid looking good girls !
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid well done girls !

documents.title: students research happiness
text: greenvale school in south-east london have told us that their students will be working on a report after half-term about what makes them happy .
greenvale have done some great work before as you can see in this report on healthy eating that was broadcast on the bbc news channel in 2014 .

documents.title: are you green on the map ?
text: is your school green on the school report map ?
schools are made red when they have registered , yellow when they have returned the consent forms and green when they have returned all forms and have also created a school report url webpage .
to check your status , click here .
remember the url of your dedicated school report web page means we can link to all those amazing stories you 've been telling .
- and are planning to tell !

documents.title: safer internet day round-up
text: our colleagues at bbc newsround have produced an excellent round-up of news and safety tips for safer internet day .

the content includes a survey on online bullying , a report which finds that more than a third of 10-12 year-olds with a social media account have made friends online they have n't met in person , and a guide to five ways to stay safe online .

documents.title: one hour down , five to go !
text: one hour into practice news day live and students across the uk , including these school reporters from knox academy in east lothian , are busy making the news .
with five hours still to go , there 's plenty of time to tell us what you 're up to !
email us at schoolreport @ bbc.co.uk with your stories .

documents.title: science is not just for boys
text: bacons college school reporters are getting ready for news day .
their teacher miss small tells us they have been busy on a report on gender issues in schools .

the reporting team are going to look at why science is so often perceived as a 'boys ' field and will be interviewing our head of science , who is a woman - as well as investigating how many girls are taking sciences at a-level in school .

they are also going to look into why girls seem to be giving up sport and exercise in their teenage years - there will be a link to the olym and they will be interviewing girls attending the 'this girl can ' project . ''

documents.title: quick off the mark in wigan
text: delighted to hear that the school reporters at st edmund arrowsmith catholic high school in wigan have made a positive start to their day !
school report
arrowsmithbbc
everyone 's off to a flying start at eddie 's , and we 're all excited for the day ahead !
@ twitterid
everyone 's off to a flying start at eddie 's , and we 're all excited for the day ahead !
@ twitterid
@ twitterid that 's great news - we are looking forward to hearing your updates !

documents.title: schools have already been busy
text: we are also going to reflect on the superb reports already produced by school reporters ahead of practice news day and follow one school which is involved in some special events for safer internet day today !

documents.title: have you told us you are taking part ?
text: we 'd like to give a big welcome to all those schools who have told us they are taking part today .
if you are participating in practice news day but have n't told us - that 's not a problem .
as long as you have signed up for the project , let us know and we will give you a shout-out in this page .

so hello to all saints ' catholic academy , alperton community school , arnold hill academy , cirencester deer park school , guildford county school , hertswood academy , inveralmond community high school , knox academy , linwood high school , longcroft school , ormiston rivers academy , st edmund arrowsmith catholic high school , st mark 's church of england academy , the mountbatten school , the regis school , waldegrave school for girls , watford grammar school for boys , whitley academy , wildern school .

documents.title: want a shout-out ?
text: we 'd love to give a shout-out to as many schools as possible between now and 16:00 , so tell us what you are working on .
email us at schoolreport @ bbc.co.uk - and do n't forget , as long as we have both of your school report forms returned to us , to send us a if you can .

documents.title: young people 'ignore social media age limit '
text: a study to mark today 's safer internet day has found that more than three-quarters of children aged 10 to 12 in the uk have social media accounts , even though they are below the official age limit .
the survey for cbbc newsround also found more than one in five has faced online bullying .

documents.title: practice news day under way
text: good morning and welcome to live coverage of our final practice news day of 2015/16 .
over the next six hours , we are going to bring you live updates of reporting from around the uk by schools gearing up for our 10th news day on thursday 10 march .
we are also going to be staying across events happening for today 's safer internet day .
